SEARCH
Package music

Class Note

java.lang.Object
music.Note
public class Note extends Object
This class represents our basic Note object. It has a pitch, an accidental, a duration, an octave, an intVal, and a pitch pos. When given another note, it gives the half step distance between itself and the other note starting from itself

    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description

    accidental
    The accidental of this note as found in the mei string.
    private final Float
    duration
    The duration of this note, or how many of this note in particular would fit in a measure.
    private final int
    intVal
    The position of the note on the 88-key keyboard, typically from 0 (the lowest A) to 87 (the highest C)
    private final int
    octave
    The octave that the note is in, typically from 0 (the lowest A to the next B) to 8 (the last C)
    private final String
    pitch
    The basic pitch of this note, before any accidentals are added
    private final int
    pitchPos
    The position of the note in any given octave, from 0 (C) to 11 (B)
    private final String
    tieState
    'i' means initial, 'm' means intermediate, and 't' means terminal.

  • Field Details

    • pitch

      private final String pitch
      The basic pitch of this note, before any accidentals are added

    • accidental

      private final String accidental
      The accidental of this note as found in the mei string. Is null if nothing is found.

    • octave

      private final int octave
      The octave that the note is in, typically from 0 (the lowest A to the next B) to 8 (the last C)

    • duration

      private final Float duration
      The duration of this note, or how many of this note in particular would fit in a measure. Dots are accounted for in this number

    • tieState

      private final String tieState
      'i' means initial, 'm' means intermediate, and 't' means terminal. TODO: currently unused.

    • pitchPos

      private final int pitchPos
      The position of the note in any given octave, from 0 (C) to 11 (B)

    • intVal

      private final int intVal
      The position of the note on the 88-key keyboard, typically from 0 (the lowest A) to 87 (the highest C)

  • Constructor Details

    • Note

      public Note(char pitch, String accidental, int octave, Float duration)
      The constructor
      Parameters:
      pitch - the pitch is the char that represents the base pitch without accidentals
      accidental - the accidental, could be null.
      octave - the octave the note is in. This is ALWAYS correct due to exporting reliability, even in the case of B sharps (increasing an octave) or C flats (decreasing an octave)
      duration - the duration of the note, occasionally this is found inside the chord or this note may be a grace note, in which case this is null.

    • Note

      public Note(char pitch, String accidental, int octave)
      The constructor
      Parameters:
      pitch - the pitch is the char that represents the base pitch without accidentals
      accidental - the accidental, could be null.
      octave - the octave the note is in. This is always correct due to exporting reliability, even in the case of B sharps (increasing an octave) or C flats (decreasing an octave)

  • Method Details

    • getHalfStepDistance

      public int getHalfStepDistance(Note n)
      When given a note, returns the half steps from itself to the given note.
      Parameters:
      n - The note we are given
      Returns:
      the distance to the note in half steps

    • getDurationRatio

      public Float getDurationRatio(Note n)
      When given a note, returns the ratio of its own duration to the given notes. TODO currently unused.
      Parameters:
      n - The note we are given
      Returns:
      the ration of duration to the note

    • makePitchPos

      private int makePitchPos(String s)
      This is a function to return the int note values in an octave given the pitch and accidental
      Parameters:
      s - the string we are inputting, a combination of 'pitch'+'accidental'.
      Returns:
      an integer representing its place in the octave

    • applyAccidental

      public Note applyAccidental(String accidental)
      This function "applies" a new accidental to a Note, ensuring we get the right one back
      Parameters:
      accidental - the accidental in question we are applying
      Returns:
      a new Note with the accidental configured
